intro: Terminalia longespicata subsp. longespicata, commonly known as the long-leaved terminalia, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that often have a leathery texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color, followed by woody, spherical fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. This subspecies is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
